NEON science designs
Project
View
Canopy Beetles
Project
Forest canopies exhibit distinct life zones. Particularly tropical rainforest canopies are famous for their species-rich beetle communities. This project is aimed to bundle the knowledge of the taxonomic composition and ecology of arboreal beetle communities. Apart from the general aspect of the characteristics of canopy-inhabiting beetles the project focuses on tropical rainforests and Neotropical forests, respectively.
View
  • 7 Updates
Surumoni crane project
Project
A general canopy beetle survey has been embedded in the interdisciplinary research project "Towards an understanding of the structure and function of a Neotropical rainforest ecosystem with special reference to its canopy" organized by the Austrian Academy of Science. Observations and collections of adult Coleoptera were carried out by means of a large tower crane on 25 canopy tree species in the northern part of the Amazonian lowland rainforest. The comprehensive field study covers a full year and was conducted between 1997 and 1999. The analyses of the data set and publication of the study results are ongoing.
